MemberSignature.Value: public CreditCard (Iot.Device.Card.CardTransceiver nfc, byte target, int tailerSize = 3);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Iot.Device.Card.CardTransceiver nfc, unsigned int8 target, int32 tailerSize) cil managed
Public Sub New (nfc As CardTransceiver, target As Byte, Optional tailerSize As Integer = 3)
new Iot.Device.Card.CreditCardProcessing.CreditCard : Iot.Device.Card.CardTransceiver * byte * int -> Iot.Device.Card.CreditCardProcessing.CreditCard

Docs.param: The target number as some readers needs it
Size of the tailer, most NFC readers add an extra byte 0x00
Docs.remarks: The target number can be found with the NFC/Card reader you are using. For example the PN532 require a target number, the normal smart card readers usually don't as they only support 1 card at a time.

MemberSignature.Value: public int GetPinTries ();
.method public hidebysig instance int32 GetPinTries() cil managed
Public Function GetPinTries () As Integer
member this.GetPinTries : unit -> int

Docs.summary: Get the number of pin tries left. Your credit card may not support this command. Use GetData(DataType.PinTryCounter) instead if you get a -1 as answer
Docs.returns: the number of tries left or -1 if not successful

.method public hidebysig instance void ReadCreditCardInformation() cil managed
Public Sub ReadCreditCardInformation ()

Docs.summary: Gather all the public information present in the credit card. Fill then Tag list with all the found information. You can get all the credit card information in the Tags property.

Docs.summary: The size of the tailer elements. Some readers add an extra byte usually 0x00 especially NFC ones. While Smart Card readers usually do not

MemberSignature.Value: public Iot.Device.Card.ErrorType VerifyPin (ReadOnlySpan<byte> pindigits);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype Iot.Device.Card.ErrorType VerifyPin(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<unsigned int8> pindigits) cil managed
Public Function VerifyPin (pindigits As ReadOnlySpan(Of Byte)) As ErrorType
member this.VerifyPin : ReadOnlySpan<byte> -> Iot.Device.Card.ErrorType

Docs.param: The pin in a byte array, between 4 and 8 array length. Pin numbers should be bytes like in the following example: byte[] pin = new byte[] { 1, 2, 3, 4 };
Docs.summary: Verify the pin. Note this command may not be supported for your specific credit card
